transcripts.text: But let's mark this moment.  Last night, the president called into question the heart of our democracy, the peaceful transition of power.  Is there assurance that it'll happen?  Asked to give it, the president declined and openly sowed the seeds of distrust in the outcome.

This is Shepard Smith, a former Fox News host who regularly did a decent job of speaking the truth, even when it disagreed with Fox News.  Ultimately, he left Fox News.  Listen to his description of last night, some of which he got perfectly right and some wrong.

But let's mark this moment.  Last night, the president called into question the heart of our democracy, the peaceful transition of power.  Is there assurance that it'll happen?  Asked to give it, the president declined and openly sowed the seeds of distrust in the outcome.  If there's no clear winner on election night, what's the process?  What does the Constitution say?  We'll report on that.  And our presidential historian will offer clarity, perspective.  In the debate, the president told a group of white supremacists, some of whom stood by those in Charlottesville with their torches, to stand back and stand by.  Joe Biden declared the duly elected president of the United States unfit to lead, called him a racist, a liar, a clown, and told him to shut up.  We've never seen any of this, not in America.  But from this, we march toward the vote.

Now, Shepard Smith is correct in how he described Donald Trump and how he described the debate last night as being something that we've never seen in America, something that was a breach of decorum and civility.  Absolutely correct.  He described the situation with Donald Trump accurately.  But what he did wrong in this exchange is that he tried to draw an equivalence between what Joe Biden did and what Donald Trump did.
Joe Biden declared the duly elected president of the United States unfit to lead.
Called him a racist, a liar, a clown, and told him to shut up.
We've never seen any of this.  Not in America.

I appreciate Shepard Smith for speaking the truth as it pertains to Donald Trump.  But let's be clear about something.  Does anyone in the anyone in their right mind think for one second that Joe Biden was not capable of having a civilized conversation last night on the issues?  The fact of the matter is, is that Donald Trump made it impossible.  And yes, Donald Trump is a racist.  He is a clown.  He is unfit to lead.  And he most certainly needs to shut his orange mouth.  So Joe Biden did nothing wrong last night.  And the problem is, is if the media continues to draw a false equivalence between the awfulness and the downright madness and sociopathy of Donald Trump last night with what Joe Biden did, then we will always have this asymmetrical fight in this country where Donald Trump can get away with inciting violence through his white supremacist militias.  while we won't be able to tell him to shut his orange mouth without the media calling us all the same.
